title: [Large-Scale] Evidence-Based Language Workshop for Enhancing Nurse Communication Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic nursing theories, clinical practice experience, and understanding of fundamental communication skills in medical settings (symptom listening, explanatory expression, documentation)
context.additional_context: Blended learning program using digital devices, structured on Gagne's instructional design principles. Focuses on medical field language expressions (diagnosis explanations, treatment plans, patient education) and text types (medical records, prescriptions, educational materials).

learning_goals: Perform assertive communication skills for patient safety (clear expression, active listening, empathetic response) with ≥80% accuracy within four weeks
Propose ≥3 communication strategies per conflict scenario (emotional regulation, nonviolent dialogue, situation-specific vocabulary selection) through role-play simulations
Achieve ≥4.0/5.0 on communication self-efficacy scales in formative assessments and improve abilities to analyze patient-nurse dialogue texts
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
